{"step_by_step_thinking": "If there is absence of precursor cell of an organ with the subsequent non development of the organ, the condition is called as agenesis. Agenesis refers to the complete absence or failure of development of an organ or tissue. Aplasia refers to the absence or underdevelopment of an organ or tissue due to the failure of cell proliferation. Atresia refers to the absence or closure of a normal body opening or tubular structure. Atrophy refers to the wasting away or shrinkage of an organ or tissue due to a decrease in cell size or number.", "answer_choice": "A"}
